JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP Overseas Territories Citizen and NORP and Caicos Islands Belonger , who was born in DATE and lives on GPE , an island in the NORP and GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a barrister practising in GPE .

CARDINAL . The NORP and GPE ( “ the Territory ” ) are ORG in LOC . At the relevant time , the CARDINAL Constitution set out the rules regarding government of the Territory . The LAW was made pursuant to powers conferred by LAW DATE which allowed Her Majesty to make Orders in Council for , inter alia , the peace , order and good government of the Territory . The LAW provided for a Governor , a ORG and an elected ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant is the former Premier of the NORP and GPE and was , at the relevant time , the elected representative of the LOC constituency and so an elected member of ORG . He is a citizen of the Territory and has been active in politics there for DATE . He became the head of ORG in DATE . He became Premier following elections in DATE and was re - elected in DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a committee of ORG published a report on LOC . It expressed grave concerns about allegations of corruption in the Territory .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the Governor appointed Sir PERSON as Commissioner to conduct an Inquiry into the allegations .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Commissioner delivered his Interim Report . He was satisfied that there was a high probability of systemic corruption and/or other serious dishonesty involving past and present elected members of ORG and others in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Governor issued a statement responding to ORG . He indicated that ORG had formed the view that parts of the CARDINAL Constitution would need to be suspended and had decided to take steps to enable it to do so . On DATE he made public a draft ORG which would suspend parts of the CARDINAL Constitution initially for DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant resigned as Premier on DATE . He remained an elected member of ORG .

CARDINAL . The Order in Council was subsequently made by Her ORG in the form of the NORP and LAW DATE ( “ the Order ” ) and laid before ORG . The Order provided that parts of the CARDINAL Constitution were suspended and direct rule was assumed over the people of the Territory . In particular , the Order dissolved ORG and removed all elected officials for DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant sought leave to apply for judicial review to challenge the legality of the Order . Regarding the removal of direct rule , the applicant argued that the LAW was inconsistent with the international law principle of self - determination ; that it was inconsistent with the right to stand for election and , once elected , to sit as a member of parliament , guaranteed by LAW No . CARDINAL to the LAW ; that it was contrary to the principle of legality and a disproportionate and irrational response to the alleged crimes of certain elected representatives ; and that it was based on the recommendations of a flawed Inquiry and on recommendations which were themselves ultra vires the Inquiry ’s terms of reference .

CARDINAL . A hearing took place in ORG on DATE . Following the hearing , and at the request of the court , the Government confirmed by letter that before bringing the Order into effect they would withdraw the application of LAW No . CARDINAL from the NORP and GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG refused permission to seek judicial review . Regarding specifically the applicant ’s argument under LAW No . CARDINAL , Lord Justice Carnwath indicated :

“ CARDINAL . ... [ T]his aspect of the argument has in my view been overtaken by events . Following the hearing we have been informed by the Treasury Solicitor that , if a decision is taken to bring the Order into force , the GPE will in effect withdraw LAW . This can be done without Parliamentary sanction . It requires a declaration to ORG under LAW modifying the application of the LAW to the territory by withdrawing the application of LAW . It will be made clear that this is a temporary measure , pending steps to restore the principles of good governance in the Territory . ”

CARDINAL . As to potential limitations on the ORG ’s power to make laws for the peace , order and good government of the Territory , ORG examined , inter alia , the special status of human rights in judicial review . He referred to ORG judgment in R ( Bancoult ) v Home Secretary ( No CARDINAL ) [ DATE ] ORG CARDINAL , where that court had examined the statutory language conferring the power , and continued :

“ CARDINAL . Even allowing for the differences between the various speeches [ in GPE ] , those of the majority in my view provide a clear message that the ORG ’s power to legislate for the good government of a territory ... , although in principle subject to judicial review , is in practice not open to question in the courts other than in the most exceptional circumstances , which did not include the abrogation of the basic right relied on in that case . I see no reason to think the rights claimed in this case , important as they are , should be accorded greater weight . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the refusal of permission to ORG arguing , inter alia , that ORG had erred in finding that the ORG ’s power to legislate was not limited by any requirement to comply with fundamental rights . The appeal was refused on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , by letter to the ORG of ORG , the Government removed the application of LAW No . CARDINAL to the NORP and GPE .
CARDINAL . The Order entered into force on DATE . Following its entry into force , the Governor was responsible for administering the Territory .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the West Indies Act DATE empowers Her Majesty to provide by ORG for the government of the Territory . The relevant part of section CARDINAL ) provides :

“ Her Majesty may by ORG make such provision as appears to Her expedient for the government of any of the colonies to which this section applies , and for that purpose may provide for the establishment for the colony of such authorities as She thinks expedient and may empower such of them as may be specified in the Order to make laws either generally for the peace , order and good government of the colony or for such limited purposes as may be so specified subject , however , to the reservation to Herself of power to make laws for the colony for such ( if any ) purposes as may be so specified . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL makes clear that the power to make an Order includes power to vary or revoke the Order .
CARDINAL . The NORP and LAW DATE entered into force on DATE . It dissolved ORG and removed all elected officials for DATE .
